answers.author: Toby Cotter
answers.text:
The AZ League offers training for newly elected officials. Our Clerk's Office administers the basic introduction to city government. I assign the PIO to give tours of city facilities, parks and areas of interest. I also set up individual meetings with all newly elected officials so that we can define and discuss the council-manager form of government. I've found that each newly elected official has unique questions at the beginning stages. And, do not forget about the HR functions. Newly elected officials will want to learn about their new benefits and salary. IT functions also play a role today if your agency assigns Ipads or laptops. They may need technology training and passwords.

answers.author: Kathleen Rush
answers.text:
I spend at least one day with newly elected officials.  I provide a binder with the following information: 
zoning map
NLC home page information
New resident welcome packet
various leadership articles
Rosters for all Boards/Committees
Staff resumes including Attorney
Org Chart
Pending litigation summary
Illinois Municipal league handbook
Elected delegation who represent the community in congress and state
Each department has an opportunity to review key projects, challenges in the departments, typical citizen concerns.  We provide a detailed financial overview.  A tour is offered of all the public facilities.

author: Andi Welsh
text:
The Town of Gilbert, AZ is developing a new elected official (Town Council) orientation program.
We are looking for information to develop a successful program, such as topics other communities discuss/present, format of other programs, sample agendas or materials that you may distribute and in general what works well or may not work well.
Thank you in advance for your assistance!
title: New Council Orientation
